00053 typedef struct
00054 {
00055   char *option;
00056   char *value;
00057 } openvassd_option;
00058 
00062 static openvassd_option openvassd_defaults[] = {
00063   {"plugins_folder", OPENVAS_NVT_DIR},
00064   {"cache_folder", OPENVAS_CACHE_DIR},
00065   {"include_folders", OPENVAS_NVT_DIR},
00066   {"max_hosts", "30"},
00067   {"max_checks", "10"},
00068   {"be_nice", "no"},
00069   {"logfile", OPENVASSD_MESSAGES},
00070   {"log_whole_attack", "no"},
00071   {"log_plugins_name_at_load", "no"},
00072   {"dumpfile", OPENVASSD_DEBUGMSG},
00073   {"cgi_path", "/cgi-bin:/scripts"},
00074   {"optimize_test", "yes"},
00075   {"checks_read_timeout", "5"},
00076   {"network_scan", "no"},
00077   {"non_simult_ports", "139, 445"},
00078   {"plugins_timeout", G_STRINGIFY (NVT_TIMEOUT)},
00079   {"safe_checks", "yes"},
00080   {"auto_enable_dependencies", "yes"},
00081   {"use_mac_addr", "no"},
00082   {"nasl_no_signature_check", "yes"},
00083   {"drop_privileges", "no"},
00084   {"unscanned_closed", "yes"},
00085   {"unscanned_closed_udp", "yes"},
00086   // Empty options must be "\0", not NULL, to match the behavior of
00087   // preferences_process.
00088   {"vhosts", "\0"},
00089   {"vhosts_ip", "\0"},
00090   {"report_host_details", "yes"},
00091   {"cert_file", SCANNERCERT},
00092   {"key_file", SCANNERKEY},
00093   {"ca_file", CACERT},
00094   {NULL, NULL}
00095 };

00100 int
00101 preferences_init (char *config_file, struct arglist **prefs)
00102 {
00103   int result;
00104   *prefs = emalloc (sizeof (struct arglist));
00105   result = preferences_process (config_file, *prefs);
00106   return (result);
00107 }
00108 
00109 
00113 int
00114 preferences_process (char *filename, struct arglist *prefs)
00115 {
00116   int i = 0;
00117   settings_iterator_t settings;
00118 
00119   while (openvassd_defaults[i].option != NULL)
00120     {
00121       arg_add_value (prefs, openvassd_defaults[i].option, ARG_STRING,
00122                      strlen (openvassd_defaults[i].value),
00123                      g_strdup (openvassd_defaults[i].value));
00124       i++;
00125     }
00126 
00127   if (!init_settings_iterator_from_file (&settings, filename, "Misc"))
00128     {
00129       while (settings_iterator_next (&settings))
00130         {
00131           gchar *old_value = arg_get_value (prefs, settings_iterator_name
00132                                             (&settings));
00133           if (old_value == NULL)
00134             arg_add_value (prefs, settings_iterator_name (&settings),
00135                            ARG_STRING,
00136                            strlen (settings_iterator_value (&settings)),
00137                            g_strdup (settings_iterator_value (&settings)));
00138           else
00139             {
00140               if (g_ascii_strcasecmp (settings_iterator_value (&settings),
00141                                       old_value) != 0)
00142                 {
00143                   g_free (old_value);
00144                   arg_set_value (prefs, settings_iterator_name (&settings),
00145                                  strlen (settings_iterator_value (&settings)),
00146                                  g_strdup (settings_iterator_value (&settings)));
00147                 }
00148             }
00149         }
00150 
00151       cleanup_settings_iterator (&settings);
00152     }
00153 
00154   arg_add_value (prefs, "config_file", ARG_STRING, strlen (filename),
00155                  estrdup (filename));
00156   return 0;
00157 }

00159 
00160 int
00161 preferences_log_whole_attack (struct arglist *preferences)
00162 {
00163   char *value;
00164   static int yes = -1;
00165 
00166   if (!preferences)
00167     {
00168       yes = -1;
00169       return -1;
00170     }
00171 
00172 
00173   if (yes >= 0)
00174     return yes;
00175 
00176   value = arg_get_value (preferences, "log_whole_attack");
00177   if (value && strcmp (value, "yes"))
00178     {
00179       yes = 0;
00180     }
00181   else
00182     yes = 1;
00183 
00184   return yes;
00185 }
00186 
00187 int
00188 preferences_optimize_test (struct arglist *preferences)
00189 {
00190   static int yes = -1;
00191   char *optimize_asc;
00192 
00193   if (!preferences)
00194     {
00195       yes = -1;
00196       return -1;
00197     }
00198 
00199 
00200   if (yes >= 0)
00201     return yes;
00202 
00203   optimize_asc = arg_get_value (preferences, "optimize_test");
00204   if (optimize_asc && !strcmp (optimize_asc, "no"))
00205     yes = 0;
00206   else
00207     yes = 1;
00208 
00209   return yes;
00210 }

00216 preferences_log_plugins_at_load (struct arglist *preferences)
00217 {
00218   static int yes = -1;
00219   char *pref;
00220 
00221   if (!preferences)
00222     {
00223       yes = -1;
00224       return -1;
00225     }
00226 
00227 
00228   if (yes >= 0)
00229     return yes;
00230 
00231   pref = arg_get_value (preferences, "log_plugins_name_at_load");
00232   if (pref && !strcmp (pref, "yes"))
00233     yes = 1;
00234   else
00235     yes = 0;
00236 
00237   return yes;
00238 }

00240 
00241 int
00242 preferences_plugins_timeout (struct arglist *preferences)
00243 {
00244   static int to = -1;
00245   char *pref;
00246 
00247   if (!preferences)
00248     {
00249       to = -1;
00250       return -1;
00251     }
00252 
00253 
00254   if (to >= 0)
00255     return to;
00256 
00257   pref = arg_get_value (preferences, "plugins_timeout");
00258   if (pref)
00259     {
00260       to = atoi (pref);
00261       if (to == 0)
00262         to = NVT_TIMEOUT;
00263     }
00264   else
00265     to = NVT_TIMEOUT;
00266 
00267   return to;
00268 }
00269 
00270 
00280 int
00281 preferences_plugin_timeout (struct arglist *preferences, char *oid)
00282 {
00283   int ret = 0;
00284   char *pref_name = g_strdup_printf ("timeout.%s", oid);
00285 
00286   if (arg_get_type (preferences, pref_name) == ARG_STRING)
00287     {
00288       int to = atoi (arg_get_value (preferences, pref_name));
00289       if (to)
00290         ret = to;
00291     }
00292 
00293   efree (&pref_name);
00294   return ret;
00295 }
00296 
00297 int
00298 preferences_benice (struct arglist *preferences)
00299 {
00300   char *pref;
00301   static int yes = -1;
00302 
00303   if (preferences == NULL)
00304     {
00305       return yes;
00306     }
00307 
00308 
00309   if (yes >= 0)
00310     return yes;
00311 
00312   pref = arg_get_value (preferences, "be_nice");
00313   if (pref && !strcmp (pref, "yes"))
00314     yes = 1;
00315   else
00316     yes = 0;
00317 
00318   return yes;
00319 }
00320 
00321 
00330 int
00331 preferences_drop_privileges (struct arglist *preferences)
00332 {
00333   int ret = 0;
00334 
00335   if (preferences == NULL)
00336       return ret;
00337 
00338   if (arg_get_type (preferences, "drop_privileges") == ARG_STRING)
00339     {
00340       if (strcmp (arg_get_value (preferences, "drop_privileges"), "yes") == 0)
00341         ret = 1;
00342     }
00343 
00344   return ret;
00345 }
00346

00348 int
00349 preferences_safe_checks_enabled (struct arglist *preferences)
00350 {
00351   static int yes = -1;
00352   char *value;
00353 
00354   if (!preferences)
00355     {
00356       yes = -1;
00357       return -1;
00358     }
00359 
00360 
00361   if (yes >= 0)
00362     return yes;
00363   value = arg_get_value (preferences, "safe_checks");
00364   if (value && !strcmp (value, "yes"))
00365     yes = 1;
00366   else
00367     yes = 0;
00368 
00369   return yes;
00370 }

00380     {
00381       yes = -1;
00382       return -1;
00383     }
00384 
00385 
00386   if (yes >= 0)
00387     return yes;
00388 
00389 
00390   pref = arg_get_value (preferences, "nasl_no_signature_check");

00392     yes = 1;
00393   else
00394     yes = 0;
00395 
00396   return yes;

00399 
00405 int
00406 preferences_get_bool (struct arglist *preferences, char *name)
00407 {
00408   char *pref = arg_get_value (preferences, name);
00409 
00410   if (!pref || pref[0] == '\0')
00411     return -1;
00412   if (!strcmp (pref, "no"))
00413     return 0;
00414   if (!strcmp (pref, "yes"))
00415     return 1;
00416 
00417   return -1;
00418 }
00419 
00420 
00424 char *
00425 preferences_get_string (struct arglist *preferences, char *name)
00426 {
00427   char *pref = arg_get_value (preferences, name);
00428 
00429   if (pref && pref[0] != '\0' && strcmp (pref, "no"))
00430     return pref;
00431   else
00432     return NULL;
00433 }
00434 
00435 
00443 void
00444 preferences_reset_cache ()
00445 {
00446   preferences_log_whole_attack (NULL);
00447   preferences_optimize_test (NULL);
00448   preferences_log_plugins_at_load (NULL);
00449   preferences_plugins_timeout (NULL);
00450   preferences_benice (NULL);
00451   preferences_safe_checks_enabled (NULL);
00452 }
